name: Ollie
description: A foundational skateboarding trick where the rider and board leap into the air without the use of the rider's hands.

name: Kickflip
description: A trick where the skateboard flips under the rider's feet while jumping, making a 360-degree horizontal rotation along its long axis.

name: Pop Shove-it
description: Involves the board spinning 180 degrees along its axis while the rider jumps, without flipping.

name: Heelflip
description: Similar to a kickflip, but the board rotates in the opposite direction, flipping 360 degrees while airborne.

name: Varial Kickflip
description: A combination trick involving the board spinning 180 degrees along its axis (like a pop shove-it) and flipping 360 degrees (like a kickflip).

name: Frontside 180
description: A trick where the rider and board rotate 180 degrees in the air, turning frontside (facing forward).

name: Backside 180
description: Similar to a frontside 180, but the rider and board rotate 180 degrees with the back facing the direction of rotation.

name: Frontside Boardslide
description: Involves sliding the underside of the skateboard's deck along a rail or ledge, with the rider facing forward during the slide.

name: Backside Lipslide
description: Similar to a frontside boardslide, but the rider approaches the rail or ledge with their back to the direction of travel.

name: 360 Flip
description: Combines a 360-degree spin along the vertical axis with a kickflip, resulting in a board that both spins and flips during the trick.

name: Hardlflip
description: A combination trick involving a frontside pop shove-it and a kickflip, resulting in the board flipping and spinning simultaneously.

name: Nollie Heelflip
description: Similar to a heelflip, but performed with a nollie stance, where the rider uses the front foot to pop the nose of the skateboard.

name: 360 Hardflip
description: Combines a 360-degree spin along the vertical axis with a hardflip, resulting in a complex rotation and flip.

name: Varial Heelflip
description: A combination trick involving a heelflip and a pop shove-it, resulting in the board spinning 180 degrees along its axis while flipping.

name: Inward Heelflip
description: A variation of the heelflip where the board rotates inward (towards the rider) while flipping.
